docs.snippet: Special Meeting of the Brooklyn Common Council. THE WATER WORKS--THE CABLE CELEBRATION--AN INVITATION TO ATTEND CHURCH ACCEPTED. A special meeting of the Brooklyn Common council was held last evening. President KALBELAINCH in the Chair.

headline.main: YELLOW FEVER.; Citizens of New-Brigton--Castleton Board of Health--The Health Officer and the Iron Scow.

docs.lead_paragraph: To His Honor the Mayor and Commissioners of Health of the City of New York: SIRS: The following document, emanating from the Castleton Board of Health, and signed by thirty citizens of New-Brighton, was placed in my hands by Ills Honor, the Mayor, on Saturday last: NEW-BRIGHTON, Aug. 26, 1858.

docs.snippet: The Vanderbilt steamer North Star from Havre and Southampton on the 18th inst., arrived off Cape Race on Friday afternoon, and we publish this morning a brief summary of her new received by telegraph. The advices from India are interesting, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Vanderbilt steamer North Star from Havre and Southampton on the 18th inst., arrived off Cape Race on Friday afternoon, and we publish this morning a brief summary of her new received by telegraph. The advices from India are interesting, and indicate the continued success of the British arms.

docs.snippet: YELLOW FEVER ON STATEN ISLAND.-Dr. EDWARD C. MUNDY, the Health Commissioner of the town of Stapleton, in a report which we print this morning, states that yellow fever exists as an epidemic in Tompkinsville, where seventeen cases have occurred, six...
docs.lead_paragraph: YELLOW FEVER ON STATEN ISLAND.-Dr. EDWARD C. MUNDY, the Health Commissioner of the town of Stapleton, in a report which we print this morning, states that yellow fever exists as an epidemic in Tompkinsville, where seventeen cases have occurred, six of which proved fatal.

docs.snippet: By the Cahawha, at New-Orleans, we have advices from Havana to the 18th inst. The news of the successful laying of the Atlantic cable was received with much enthusiasm in Havana, and in all probability and attempt will soon he made to communicate...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the Cahawha, at New-Orleans, we have advices from Havana to the 18th inst. The news of the successful laying of the Atlantic cable was received with much enthusiasm in Havana, and in all probability and attempt will soon he made to communicate with the United States in the same manner.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dr. Mott's Sargical Museum. LAGER AND THE CLASSICS Commissioners of Health. Police Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Professor MOTT has lately published a catalague of his Museum. The collection is composed chiefly of parts removed from the living body during his numerous operations, and comprises more than a thousand specimens. It may be found at the Fourteenth-street Medical College and is free to the public.
